name: Avoid to use keyword 'this' within Constructor in multi-thread environment
description:
This rule detects all cases where keyword 'this' is - directly or not - referenced in a constructor.
Indirect reference to keyword 'this' means the definition of an inner class in the constructor. 
It includes also the case where the constructor call the method start of a thread within a constructor (i.e. a method that inherits from java.lang.Thread.start())
output:
This report lists all constructors that involve keyword 'this' directly or indirectly.
It provides the following information:
  - Method full name
  - the number of occurrences of keyword 'this' detected in the constructor
rationale:
When making a reference to keyword 'this' within a constructor - either directly or indirectly through inner classes - visible to another thread, the result can be unpredictable.
Moreover, testing and debugging multi-threaded programs is very difficult, because of concurrency hazard that makes difficult to reproduce the issue.
remediation: In the cases where the reference to keyword 'this' is visible to other thread a redesign of the class must be made to avoid it.
alternativeName: Prefer not using keyword 'this' within Constructor in multi-thread environment to avoid unpredictable behavior
